IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE BABE RUTH BASEBALL/SOFTBALL PROGRAM, USING REGULATION COMPETITIVE BASEBALL AND SOFTBALL RULES, TEACHES SKILLS, MENTAL AND PHYSICAL DEVELOPMENT, AND RESPECT FOR THE RULES OF THE GAME, AND BASIC IDEALS OF SPORTSMANSHIP AND FAIR PLAY. IN ALL ASPECTS, BABE RUTH LEAGUE INC IS COMMITTED TO PROVIDING OUR PARTICIPANTS THE VERY BEST EDUCATIONAL, SPORTS EXPERIENCE POSSIBLE. IT IS OUR FUNDAMENTAL BELIEF THAT EVERY CHILD WITH A DESIRE TO PLAY BASEBALL OR SOFTBALL BE AFFORDED THAT OPPORTUNITY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION IS EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES UNDER INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 501(C)(3) AS A NON-PROFIT CORPORATION ABD, ACCORDINGLY, THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS DO NOT REFLECT A PROVISION FOR INCOME TAXES. THE ORGANIZATION ADOPTED THE PROVISIONS OF FASB ASC 740 (FORMERLY FIN 48), ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES, ON SEPTEMBER 1, 2009. THESE STANDARDS PRESCRIBE A RECOGNITION THRESHOLD AND MEASUREMENT ATTRIBUTE FOR THE FINANCIAL STATEMENT RECOGNITION AND MEASUREMENT OF A TAX POSITION TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN IN A TAX RETURN. THESE STANDARDS ALSO PROVIDE GUIDANCE ON DERECOGNITION OF TAX BENEFITS, CALLIFICATION ON THE BALANCE SHEET, INTEREST AND PENALTIES, ACCOUNTING IN INTERIM PERIODS, DISCLOSURE, AND TRANSITION.

IN ALL ASPECTS, BABE RUTH LEAGUE INC IS COMMITTED TO PROVIDING OUR PARTICIPANTS THE VERY BEST EDUCATIONAL, SPORTS EXPERIENCE POSSIBLE. STEVEN TELLEFSEN JOSEPH SMIEGOCKI PRESIDENT VP MARKETING FAMILY RELATIONSHIP

THE FORM 990 WAS REVIEWED IN DETAIL BY THE CEO PRIOR TO FILING. AN EMAIL IS SENT TO ALL GOVERNING BODY MEMBERS WITH A LINK TO A PASSWORD-PROTECTED WEBSITE IN WHICH THE ENTIRE FORM 990 CAN BE VIEWED PRIOR TO FILING.
AT THE ANNUAL MEETING BOARD MEMBERS ARE REQUIRED TO REVIEW THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND CONFIRM IN WRITING THEY DO NOT HAVE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST.

THE COMPENSATION OF THE CEO IS PRESENTED TO THE FINANCE COMMITTEE FOR REVIEW. ONCE THE FINANCE COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE COMPENSATION, IT IS THEN PRESENTED TO THE BOARD OF DRECTORS. EACH BOARD MEMBER VOTES ON WHETHER TO APPROVE OR DECLINE THE COMPENSATION.

THE COMPENSATION OF THE CEO IS PRESENTED TO THE FINANCE COMMITTEE FOR REVIEW. ONCE THE FINANCE COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE COMPENSATION, IT IS THEN PRESENTED TO THE BOARD OF DRECTORS. EACH BOARD MEMBER VOTES ON WHETHER TO APPROVE OR DECLINE THE COMPENSATION.
THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT MAKE ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, POLICIES, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.
